November 26, 2019

ESSENTIAL OILS FOR HAIR DANDRUFF

Post By smartcoders

Hair Dandruff is very common skin condition and nowadays, people of every age groups are facing this problem. Dandruff is a kind of skin condition that affects the scalp. Symptoms of dandruff include white flakes of skin on shoulders, itchiness and irritation in the scalp skin, drying of scalp skin, scaly facial skin, eyebrow & beard rash, chest rash with dry skin flakes & redness etc.
Dandruff can have several causes like Itchy & Irritated skin, dry & oily skin, emotional & mental stress, dust & pollution, poor hygiene, weather conditions, poor immune system, not shampooing properly, some fungal infections, using chemical containing hair care products, other skin problems such as eczema & psoriasis etc.
Treating hair dandruff regularly with essential oils can be more effective. There are essential oils that helps in boosting circulation & providing nourishment to the scalp which naturally eliminates dandruff. Some essential oils help in maintaining the skin quality of the scalp which is important for healthy scalp skin free from infections. Here is the list of some essential oils that helps in reducing hair dandruff and provides clean & non-itchy scalp skin:

    1. Lavender Oil: Lavender oil helps in promoting & providing proper nourishment to the scalp that enhances hair growth and hair quality and fights dandruff to make scalp skin clean & non-itchy.     
      How to use: Mix 2-3 drops of lavender oil with 10 ml of coconut oil and massage hair and scalp to reduce dandruff.
    2. Tea Tree Oil: Tea Tree Oil is good for hair and it helps in fighting against dandruff with its anti-fungal & anti-microbial properties and keeps lice away as well.
      How to use: Mix 5 drops of tea tree oil with 10 ml in any of the carrier oils like coconut, jojoba, almond oil and apply to scalp and hair.
    3. Almond Oil: Almond oil helps in promoting & enhancing hair quality and its growth. It gives nourishment and strength to your hair and keeps hair scalp free from dandruff conditions.         How to use: Warm 1 tbsp of Almond oil and massage it on the scalp every night to nourish hair and make it stronger.
    4. Eucalyptus Oil: Eucalyptus Oil helps in fighting against hair dandruff and keeps hair nourished with its anti-fungal & anti-microbial properties and keeps lice away as well.

      How to use: Mix 3 drops of Eucalyptus oil into a suitable carrier oil and gently massage on the scalp. Wash after an hour.

    5. Onion Seed Oil: Onion seed Oil nourishes and stimulates scalp and helps in encouraging the growth of new hair. It gives strength to your hair and keeps hair scalp free from dandruff conditions.<br>

      How to use: Mix 4-5 drops of onion seed oil in 10 ml of coconut or olive, and apply on scalp and massage.

    6. Lemongrass Oil: Lemongrass Oil contains anti-fungal properties that helps in treating scalp infection and helps in reducing dandruff.
         How to use: Add 5 drops of lemongrass oil to 5 tsp of coconut oil. Gently massage and leave it for 1 hour before washing to get relief from dandruff.
    7. Rosemary Oil: Rosemary oil helps in stimulating hair growth. Massaging the scalp will help in reducing dandruff and improving hair quality. It will not clog the follicles.
         How to use: Mix 4 to 5 drops of Rosemary oil in 10 ml of hair oil for healthy hair growth & massage on scalp for dandruff free scalp.
    8. Peppermint Oil: Peppermint oil helps in hair growth and prevents from fungal infection. Massaging the scalp will stimulate hair growth and removes dandruff.
         How to use: Mix 4-5 drops of Peppermint oil in 10 ml of coconut oil, and apply on scalp and massage for dandruff free scalp.
    9. Hemp Seed Oil: Hemp seed Oil helps in hair growth and prevents scalp from fungal infection. Massaging the scalp with oil will stimulate hair growth and removes dandruff.
         How to use: Apply 3 drops of Hemp Seed oil on scalp and massage for hair growth & dandruff free scalp.
    10. Jojoba Oil: Jojoba oil helps in hair growth and prevents from fungal infection. Massaging the scalp will stimulate hair growth.
         How to use: Gently warm 1-2 tbsp of jojoba oil and apply from scalp to hair tips. Wash after 20 mins.
November 6, 2019

GET SMOOTH AND LIGHTENING SKIN USING ESSENTIAL OILS

Post By smartcoders

Essential oils have the medicinal properties to treat skin conditions. Essential oils are extracted from plants, they smell amazing, and contain chemical compounds that helps in killing acne-causing bacteria to help in regulating hormonally stressed skin. Essential oils helps in treating different skin types such as dry skin, oily skin, sensitive skin, acne-prone skin, skin rash, pigmentation and mature skin & anti-aging.

Essential oils that play an important role for smooth and lightening skin are as follows:

  •  Lavender Oil:  

    • Essential oils have the medicinal properties to treat skin conditions. Essential oils are extracted from plants, they smell amazing, and contain chemical compounds that helps in killing acne-causing bacteria to help in regulating hormonally stressed skin. Essential oils helps in treating different skin types such as dry skin, oily skin, sensitive skin, acne-prone skin, skin rash, pigmentation and mature skin & anti-aging.

  • Rose Oil:

    • Rose oil is great for use on all skin types, including sensitive skin. Rose oil helps in promoting beautiful and radiant skin. Rose oil has excellent treatment for acne-prone skin because it has antiseptic and astringent properties. Its anti-inflammatory properties also helps in fighting acne, inflammation and skin redness.

  • Jojoba Oil:

    • Jojoba oil has been known for repairing the top layer of skin. Jojoba is also known for being light weight, which makes it a good choice for oily skin. Jojoba oil has anti-inflammatory properties which help to tame chaffing and chapping of skin, reduce redness caused by drying, ease the effects of eczema and rosacea, and keep skin calm and smooth.

  • Lemon Oil:

    • Lemon Oil acts as a detoxifying agent that nourishes, cleanses and exfoliates skin by clearing up skin issues such as oiliness and acne. Lemon oil can help fight inflammation and free radicals that can contribute to acne and photoaging. It has anti-bacterial properties that can also sanitize wounds.

  • Peppermint Oil:

    • Peppermint oil has soothing and cooling abilities that freshen the skin. It also has properties that facilitate oil secretion, making it an effective component against acne. Peppermint oil is beneficial for skin health. The natural menthol content provides an analgesic effect on the skin. It cools down hot rashes.

  • Eucalyptus Oil:

    • Eucalyptus oil active chemical components contribute to its reputation as a purifying, cleansing, clarifying, and immune-boosting oil that is good to use on skin and in aromatherapy. Eucalyptus oil is known for its pain-relieving qualities. It may also provide moisture to itchy, painful skin rashes. It has the ability to reduce or eliminate harmful surface and airborne bacteria, and infections.

  • Rosemary Oil:

    • Rosemary oil is helpful for oily skin type and is known for its anti-inflammatory, stimulating, and analgesic properties. It can help with both oily hair & scalp skin and dandruff and stimulate hair growth. It has the ability to alleviate itchiness of skin caused due to oily scalp.

  • Tea Tree Oil:

    • Tea tree oil is a good choice for treating acne-prone skin because of its anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. It helps to calm redness, swelling, and inflammation of skin. It may even help to prevent and reduce acne scars, leaving smooth and clear skin. It helps fight bacteria which contributes to acne breakouts.

  • Frankincense Oil:

    • Frankincense oil has astringent and cytophylactic qualities that helps to reduce the appearance of wrinkles and skin imperfections. It is an anti-inflammatory oil known to soothe inflamed skin by reducing the sensations of redness, swelling, and itching. It can help alleviate oily and acne-prone skin while providing lipids for aging skin.

  • Sandalwood Oil:

    • Sandalwood oil is also known for its anti-inflammatory properties because of its benefits for skin. This oil provides smoothening, hydrating, anti-aging, and moisturizing effects. Sandalwood oil contains compounds known for reducing inflammation while promoting moisture in the skin. It also has excellent cleansing, toning, and astringent properties, which make it a prominent ingredient in soaps and creams.

October 18, 2019

Treating Cough & Cold with Essential Oils

Post By smartcoders

Nowadays, Common Cold has become a common disease among babies, children, adults & old people. It is a viral infectious disease that infects the upper respiratory system. It’s very symptoms include dry or sore throat, blocked or runny nose, and sneezing. Around a quarter of people do not experience symptoms when infected with a cold.
Essential Oils plays a very important role in such infections like common cold & cough. Some of the medical communities give more preference to essential oils therapy rather than medical treatments. There are some essential oils that can be helpful in symptoms of a cough or cold by soothing the throat, fighting bacteria & reducing inflammation. We found that using a nasal spray containing a blend of eucalyptus, peppermint, oregano, and rosemary extracts can improve a sore throat, hoarseness, and other cough-related symptoms.
so, there is a list of few essential oils that are helpful in common cold diseases with its usages:
1. Eucalyptus Oil: Eucalyptus oil may also help to reduce inflammation, relieve pain, and ease muscle tension that can result from a cold or flu. It can be used to calm cold & cough in many ways.

Usage:

  •  Adding 5-6 drops of eucalyptus oil to 1 ounce of carrier oil and rubbing the mixture onto the chest and throat.
  • Adding 1 tbsp of eucalyptus oil in boiling water and inhaling the steam.
  1. Peppermint Oil: Peppermint oil contains extract known as menthol. It has cooling properties that may help in the soothing and calming scratchy throat.

Usage: 

  • Adding 1 tbsp of the oil in boiling water and inhaling the steam.
  • Adding 10-15 drops of oil to a diffuser.
  • Peppermint oil can be used in a blend of tropical oils
  1. . Tea Tree Oil: Tea Tree oil has the properties that can inhibit the growth of bacteria & viruses responsible for causing cold & cough.

Usage:

  • Inhaling tea tree oil may also help to ease the effects of cold & cough.
  • Adding 10-15 drops of oil to a diffuser.
  1. Geranium Oil: It has been found that geranium has an extract that has herbal properties for cough treatment.

Usage:

  • It has a refreshing floral scent that creates a refreshing and calming atmosphere when suffering from cold.
  • It has therapeutic properties and can be used in bathwater.

5. Frankincense Oil: Frankincense oil is generally used in incense and perfumes just

because of its natural and refreshing aroma. It has some medical properties that help in the respiratory system.
Usage:

  • Mix 5 drops in 1 tbsp of carrier oil and rub on chest and throat for cold relief.
  • Use 5-6 drops of frankincense oil in boiling water and inhale the steam so as to get relief from a blocked nose.
  1. Bergamot Oil: Bergamot oil helps in relieving congestion. It contains camphene, a compound similar to camphor which also helps in cold & cough.

Usage:

  • Use 5-6 drops of Bergamot oil in boiling water and inhale the steam so as to get relief from cold & scratchy throat.
  • Adding 10-15 drops of oil in-home diffuser so to get the relaxing aroma and relieve from cold. 

 

September 29, 2019

IMPORTANT BENEFITS TO KNOW ABOUT LAVENDER OIL

Post By smartcoders

IMPORTANT BENEFITS TO KNOW ABOUT LAVENDER OIL
Now a days, Lavender Essential Oil is widely used throughout the world. It has been mostly used in world over more than 2000 years. So here are some important points to know about Lavender Essential Oil:

1. Reduces Stress &amp; Promotes Sleep: Lavender oil helps in destressing and encouraging a peaceful atmoshphere by reducing stress and tension. It supports the immune system by reducing feelings of stress that can weaken body and mind. It also helps in promoting sleep which is necessary for healthy body and mind.

2. Face Care &amp;Acne control: Lavender oil works to kill bacteria, prevent and heal acne breakouts. It has antioxidant and antiseptic properties that helps in reducing itching and irritating inflammation on skin. It opens up pores and reduces inflammation when you put it on your skin which makes skin lighten, glowing and free of dark spots. Lavender oil is full of anti-oxidents which also helps in reducing wrinkles and makes skin look smooth and young.

3. Hair Care: Lavender oil is used to be a good oil for hair. Lavender oil can help in keeping lice away as it has properties that could kill hair lice. It can be helpful in treating infections of the scalp and scalp dryness. Lavender oil may also help in treating baldness and promotes healthy hair growth. It helps in preventing from scalp issues like itchy scalp, dandruff, and infections.

4. Body Massage: Lavender oil is beneficial in massage. By massaging with lavender oil soothes many types of pain, both mental and physical like muscle aches, joint pains, backaches,headaches and sprains.. It also boosts up blood circulation, lowers blood pressure, and strengthens muscles. By massaging with lavender oil helps in uplifting the mood, gives relief to muscles and bones and relaxes you mentally and physically.

5. Natural Bug Repellent: Lavender oil is a natural bug repellent, using lavender as a natural scent regularly in routine may keep the bugs away. Lavender oil is a natural mosquito repellent it is used to keeps mosquitoes away. If you want to avoid the toxic and chemical-laden bug sprays, lavender oil is a good choice.

6. Delightful Fragrance: Lavender essential oil has a light fresh aroma, its scent being described as floral-herbaceous, light, clear, balsamic, with woody undertones, and slightly camphorous. In addition to its delightful fragrance, it also has anti-anxiety, mood promoting, pain-relieving and neuroprotective properties.

7. Burns &amp; wounds Healer: Lavender oil is widely used on burns and skin wounds from past many years. It has antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties that can help with the healing process whether you experience a burn, cut or injury.

8.Reduces Skin Iching: Lavender oil is a good choice as it has antioxidant and antiseptic properties that helps in reducing itching and irritating inflammation whether it’s a bug bites, mosquitoe bites, sunburn, or another form of skin irritation. It works as a skin booster by reducing ichiness and redness.
